sn5.8:4.2: Then the nun Sīsupacālā got dressed in the morning …
sn5.8:4.3: and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
sn5.8:4.4: The Māra the Wicked went up to Sīsupacālā
sn5.8:4.6: “Nun, whose creed do you believe in?”
sn5.8:4.7: “I don’t believe in anyone’s creed, sir.”
sn5.8:5.1: “In whose name did you shave your head?
sn5.8:5.3: but you don’t believe in any creed.
sn5.8:5.4: Why do you live as if lost?”
sn5.8:6.3: But I don’t believe in their teaching,
sn5.8:6.4: for they’re no experts in the Dhamma.
sn5.8:7.1: But there is one born in the Sakyan clan,
sn5.8:8.3: He’s attained the end of all deeds,
sn5.8:8.4: freed with the end of attachments.
sn5.8:8.5: That Blessed One is my Teacher,
sn5.8:8.6: and I believe in his instruction.”
sn5.8:9.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The nun Sīsupacālā knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
